document.discussion_title: Women’s Fund of Essex County to hold Power of the Purse fundraiser
document.topic_text: Posted Apr. 25, 2016 at 11:59 AM Updated at 11:59 AM Posted Apr. 25, 2016 at 11:59 AM AMESBURY The Women’s Fund of Essex County will host its eighth annual Power of the Purse fundraiser. Inspired by the Victor Hugo’s comment, “As the purse is emptied, the heart is filled,” this signature event features an evening of hors d’oeuvres, wine and raffle prizes including purses donated by renowned designers and retailers. The fundraiser will be held 6:30-9 p.m. May 12 at the Willowdale Estate in Bradley Palmer State Park, 24 Asbury St., Topsfield. Proceeds benefit special projects and annual grant awards from The Women’s Fund. Founded in 2003, The Women’s Fund is a community of women, families and businesses dedicated to creating social change for local women and girls in need or at risk. The Women’s Fund awards grants to high-impact nonprofit programs in Essex County that change the lives of women and girls in significant and sustainable ways. In addition, the fund works to raise awareness of the needs and issues impacting local women and girls and of the power of philanthropy to help change the community and world. To date, The Women’s Fund has awarded over $1,335,000 in grants to Essex County nonprofit organizations. Tickets cost $45 in advance and $50 at the door. For information and tickets: thewomensfundec.org . North of Boston
